title: Ed Dwight “Ecstatic” At Finally Reaching Space
summary: Ed Dwight, who went through training in the early days of the space program that he thought would make him NASA’s first black astronaut, fulfilled his dream of seeing Earth […]

title: Blue Origin resumes crewed New Shepard suborbital flights
summary: Blue Origin conducted its first crewed New Shepard mission in nearly two years May 19, carrying six people, including the first American Black astronaut candidate, on a suborbital spaceflight the company called a success despite a parachute issue.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy May 19-25, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of May 19-25, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session […]

title: Pentagon to forge deeper ties with space industry in ‘first-of-its-kind’ program
summary: Under the Commercial Augmentation Space Reserve program, companies would sign partnership agreements with DoD to bolster U.S. satellite capacity for potential space conflicts

title: NASA prepares for twin launches of climate science cubesats
summary: NASA is gearing up for back-to-back launches of cubesats designed to provide key data for improving models of the Earth’s climate.

title: How the Space Shuttle completed a final, daring Hubble repair 15 years ago
summary: The Hubble Space Telescope continues to operate to this day in part due to the work performed 15 years ago by the crew of STS-125. Dubbed Hubble Servicing Mission 4 (HSM 4), scientists knew this would be their final chance to use the space shuttle to visit and upgrade the orbiting laboratory.

title: Another Delay for the Starliner Crew Flight Test — now May 25
summary: Boeing is delaying the launch of the Starliner Crew Flight Test yet again. The most recent delay, from May 17 to May 21, was due to a helium leak in […]

title: Helium leak further delays Starliner crewed test flight
summary: NASA and Boeing have once again delayed first crewed flight of the company’s CST-100 Starliner as they work to resolve a helium leak in the spacecraft’s propulsion system.

title: India enters troubled space insurance market
summary: Indian insurance specialist Tata AIG is expanding into space as the global market reels from a string of heavy losses.

title: Startup’s chip design aims to boost satellite computing power
summary: A Carnegie Mellon University spinoff, Efficient Computer, developed a chip architecture that promises reduced energy consumption
